description: From Middle French dissuader, from Latin dissuādeō (“I urge differently”, “I advise against”, “I dissuade”), from dis- (“away from”, “asunder”) + suādeō (“I recommend”, “I advise”, “I urge”).

verbs.description: dissuade (third-person singular simple present dissuades, present participle dissuading, simple past and past participle dissuaded)

entries.meaning: (transitive) To convince not to try or do.
examples: Jane dissuaded Martha from committing suicide.
